title: Advanced Technology Behind Kenya Airways Flight Status and Online Booking System (Pooja Shree)
text: By Pooja Shree Jul 18, 2015 Kenya Airways, the flag carrier of Kenya, is a leading airline company of sub-Sahara region of Africa. In terms of seat capacity, it is the fourth largest carrier in the continent. It operates from its hub at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport and flies to more than 50 destinations worldwide using its fleet of about 40 airplanes. The airline has codeshare partnership with 18 carriers and permits booking of tickets to destinations reached by these airlines from its ticketing platform. The carrier has clearly defined objective to adopt the best global practices for its operations. These include technologies in aviation navigation and tracking, providing multiple interfaces of interaction with passengers, and ensuring total safety and security of airplanes and passengers. In pursuance of these objectives, the carrier enables prospective flyers to get all information and book tickets online. Even real-time information about the Kenya Airways flight status can be known online. In order to know the status of flights using its website, passengers are required to provide flight number. Unlike many other carriers, which seek information of origin and destination points, and date of departure as an alternative for displaying flight status, Kenya Airways requires only the flight number information. As an alternative, it asks people to use call centre and has provided a telephone number for this purpose. Booking a Flight Travellers can book a flight by calling its call centre or by using its website or mobile application. Kenya Airways flight booking can be done for one-way, return and multi-city flights. Besides, the interface also provides for a Brand Ambassador booking type. In this, visitors are required to fill in the form mentioning the Kenya Airline staff who has recommended using its website for booking purpose. This serves to recognise and reward those staff members who encourage their contacts to book tickets using the website. Online Check-in Kenya Airways also provides online check-in facility to passengers. Online check-in begins from 30 hours and continues till 2 hours before scheduled departure of flights. This is in keeping with the latest trends of check-in methods adopted by other global airline companies. In addition to the online facility, passengers can always visit the airline desks at airports. For this, they are required to arrive at airport at least 1 hour 30 minutes before scheduled departure of domestic flights and 2 hour 30 minutes before departure of international flights. Priority check-in and boarding facilities are extended to its frequent flyer program - Flying Blue - members. Other Online Services Kenya Airways also manages its suppliers and receivables from its iSupplier and iReceivables systems. It provides iSafari to its staff members who can log in using their staff numbers and passwords. The carrier also has a mobile application, which makes online tickets booking easy.Integration of world-class technological systems and adoption of best practices in all aspects of aviation has made Kenya airline one of the leading carriers of African continent. Banking upon these strengths, it expects to expand its reach to more destinations around the globe, either by direct operation or by using services of partner airlines. Expansion in fleet has been going on since 2010 and initiation of Project Mawingu to add 24 new destinations by 2021 are a testimony of its growth plans. About the Author Kenya Airways is one of the best option for International flight bookings. Rating:
